get.description: Get attachment information. Note that this operation can return either the metadata of the attachment, or the binary content of the attachment. The difference is based on whether the query parameter type is specified. Secured by: REST API Public Contains attachment(s) only

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2377 | You can't edit this requisition because it either is invalid or isn't in Draft or In Progress status.

parameters.name: reqTypeBillOnly
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are bill only and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeBillOnly=true and reqTypeJustInTime=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeBillOnly and reqTypeJustInTime are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeBillOnly=true and reqTypeJustInTime=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeConsignment
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are consignment and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeConsignment=true and reqTypeBillOnly=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeConsignment and reqTypeBillOnly are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeConsignment=true and reqTypeBillOnly=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeInvReplenishment
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are inventory replenishment and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeInvReplenishment=true and reqTypeJustInTime=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeInvReplenishment and reqTypeJustInTime are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeInvReplenishment=true and reqTypeJustInTime=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeJustInTime
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are just in time and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeJustInTime=true and reqTypeConsignment=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeJustInTime and reqTypeConsignment are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeJustInTime=true and reqTypeConsignment=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeParReplenishment
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are par replenishment and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, , reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeParReplenishment=true and reqTypeConsignment=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeParReplenishment and reqTypeConsignment are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeParReplenishment=true and reqTypeConsignment=false.

parameters.description: If true, retrieves all requisition types. If false, the requisitionType parameter will be used to filter results.

parameters.name: reqTypeSupplierContract
parameters.description: If true, retrieves requisition types that are Supplier Contract Request and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract.

parameters.name: requisitionType

The Workday ID of the requisition type. If populated, retrieve all requisition types that exactly match the combination of usages of the requisition type passed (e.g. Inventory Replenishment and Bill Only). 

If not populated, the default is the combination of reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, and reqTypeConsignment.

Ignored if reqTypeShowAllTypes is populated.

delete.description: Deletes a line from the requisition with the specified ID. You can delete a requisition line only if all these conditions are true: * The requisition status is Draft or In Progress. * The requisition has more than 1 requisition line. * The requisition line is not part of the selected requisition. Secured by: Checkout (REST) Scope: Procurement

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Deleting resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A315 | Cannot delete requisition line. A Deliverable, Service or Goods Line is required on the Requisition.
A330 | Cannot delete line. You must have at least 1 line remaining with a Spend Category that has Allocate Freight if there are Freight Charges.
A333 | Cannot delete requisition line. Requisition line is not part of the Requisition.
A334 | Cannot delete line. You must have at least 1 line remaining with a Spend Category that has Allocate Other Charges if there are Other Charges.
A342 | Cannot delete requisition line where status is not Draft or In Progress.
A1082 | Requisitions with a source of Workday Strategic Sourcing cannot remove lines.
A2377 | You can't edit this requisition because it either is invalid or isn't in Draft or In Progress status.

patch.summary: Edits a specific requisition line for the requisition with the specified ID.
patch.description: Partially updates a requisition line for the requisition with the specified ID. To enable bulk support, specify "bulk=true" as a query parameter instead of the {requisitionLine-id} path parameter. You must specify the data[] in the request body, where each array item is the requisition line. For each requisition line in the array, specify the requisition line id in the id attribute, along with the fields to update. The maximum array size is 20. Only the following fields can be edited on the line: memo, endDate, quantity, requestedDeliveryDate, lotSerialInformation, worktags, startDate, supplierItemIdentifier, and unitCost. **Starting in v3:** The following fields can also be edited: deliverToLocation, shipToAdressReference, unitOfMeasure, spendCategory, supplier, shipToAddress You can call these GET /values/requisitionsGroups subresources to retrieve values for the requisition and its requisition lines. These prompt value endpoints return the values that the user has access to. * supplierContract: Retrieves all prompt values for supplier contract. You can filter the resources by supplier and requisition. * deliverToLocation: Retrieves all prompt values for deliver-to location. Only applicable to non-inventory requisitions. You can filter the resources by company, req type, and requisitionLine. * shipToAddress: Retrieves all prompt values for ship-to address. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate, company, requester, and requisitionLine. * unitOfMeasure: Retrieves all prompt values for unit of measure. * spendCategory: Retrieves all prompt values for spend category. * resourceProvider: Retrieves all prompt values for resource provider. You can use these values for the supplier field. You can filter the resources by company, currency, supplier, and supplierContract * worktags: Retrieves prompt values for worktags. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate and requisitionLine. resolvedWorktags: Retrieves worktag prompt values that have been resolved between the existingWorktags and selectedWorktags. The returned set will have only one worktag per worktag type and be valid for submission with a requisition or requisition line. Worktags passed under selectedWorktags will take precedence between selectedWorktags and existingWorktags in resolving duplicate worktags of a single type. Secured by: Checkout (REST), Process: Requisition - Create/Edit, Self-Service: Requisition Scope: Procurement

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A310 | Request includes field(s) that are not allowed for this operation of the requisition line.
A329 | [invalid requisition line worktag value message]
A348 | Service requests are not allowed for the selected company.
A1602 | Supplier Contract Request requisitions don't support these fields on the lines: [Supplier Contract, No Charge, RFQ Required, Requested Delivery Date, Supplier Item Identifier].
A1604 | The calculated extended amount on the requisition line can't be zero.
A2377 | You can't edit this requisition because it either is invalid or isn't in Draft or In Progress status.

get.description: Retrieves the goods and service line details of a requisition template with the specified ID. This operation returns only requisition templates that are authorized for use by the processing worker. You can use the response data from this endpoint to: * Create a new requisition using POST /requisitions. * Add a requisition line to an existing requisition using POST /requisitions/{ID}/requisitionLines. Secured by: REST API Public

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: reqTypeBillOnly
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are bill only and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeBillOnly=true and reqTypeJustInTime=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeBillOnly and reqTypeJustInTime are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeBillOnly=true and reqTypeJustInTime=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeConsignment

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeConsignment=true and reqTypeBillOnly=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeConsignment and reqTypeBillOnly are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeConsignment=true and reqTypeBillOnly=false.

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker for whom the requisition is requested. The reference ID uses the Employee_ID=sampleRefId format. Example: Employee_ID=21005

parameters.name: requisition
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition.

parameters.name: requisitionDate
parameters.description: The requisition date using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: requisitionLine
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition line.

parameters.name: requisitionType
parameters.description:
The Workday ID of the requisition type. If populated, retrieve all requisition types that exactly match the combination of usages of the requisition type passed (e.g. Inventory Replenishment and Bill Only). 

If not populated, the default is the combination of reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, and reqTypeConsignment.

Ignored if reqTypeShowAllTypes is populated.

The reason codes are configured on the Maintain Procurement Reasons task. Secured by: Process: Requisition - Close Scope: Procurement

parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

--- | ---

get.description: Retrieves all requisitions. You can filter the requisitions by submitter, date, requester, and type. Secured by: Checkout (REST), Process: Requisition - Reporting, Process: Requisition - View, Self-Service: Requisition, Self-Service: Supplier Contact Tasks, View: Organization Requisition Scope: Procurement

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Filters the requisitions with document date on or after the specified date. Use the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: Filters the requisitions by requester. Specify the Workday ID of the worker who requested the requisition.

parameters.name: requisitionType
parameters.description: Filters the requisitions by type. Specify the Workday ID of the requisition type. You can specify multiple requisitionType query parameters.

parameters.name: submittedBy
parameters.description: Filters the requisitions by the Worker who submitted the requisition. Specify the Workday ID or the reference ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing REST web service.

parameters.name: submittedByPerson
parameters.description: Filters the requisitions by the Person who submitted the requisition. Specify the Workday ID or the reference ID of the person.

parameters.name: submittedBySupplier
parameters.description: Filters the requisitions by the supplier who submitted the requisition. Specify the Workday ID or the reference ID of the supplier. You can specify multiple submittedBySupplier query parameters.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Filters the requisitions with document date on or before the specified date. Use the yyyy-mm-dd format.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: Creates a requisition with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least the required fields: requester {id}, requisitionLines[]. For each requisition line of a catalog item, supplier item, or purchase item, specify at least item{id} and quantity. The item pricing information for the item will be derived and populated on the requisition line. **Starting in v3:** To add a write-in requisition line, specify the requisition line either as a write-in goods line or a write-in services line: * For a write-in goods line: Set writeInGoods to true. Specify itemDescription, spendCategory{id}, unitOfMeasure{id}, and quantity. * For a write-in services line: Set writeInService to true. Specify itemDescription and spendCategory{id}. Note that item lines and write-in lines are mutually exclusive. If you specify an item{id}, the pricing information on the item will take precedence over any of the information passed in manually. You can call these GET /values/requisitionsGroups subresources to retrieve values for the requisition and its requisition lines. These prompt value endpoints return the values that the user has access to. * currencies: Retrieves all prompt values for currency. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate and company. * requesters: Retrieves all prompt values for requesting workers. * companies: Retrieves all prompt values for company. * supplierContract: Retrieves all prompt values for supplier contract. You can filter the resources by supplier and requisition. * deliverToLocation: Retrieves all prompt values for deliver-to location. Only applicable to non-inventory requisitions. You can filter the resources by company, requisitionType, and requisitionLine. * shipToAddress: Retrieves all prompt values for ship-to address. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate, company, requester, and requisitionLine. * unitOfMeasure: Retrieves all prompt values for unit of measure. * spendCategory: Retrieves all prompt values for spend category. * resourceProvider: Retrieves all prompt values for resource provider. You can use these values for the supplier field. You can filter the resources by company, currency, supplier, and supplierContract. * worktags: Retrieves prompt values for worktags. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate and requisitionLine. * resolvedWorktags: Retrieves worktag prompt values that have been resolved between the existingWorktags and selectedWorktags (under prompt values). The returned set will have only one worktag per worktag type and be valid for submission with a requisition or requisition line. Worktags passed under selectedWorktags will take precedence between selectedWorktags and existingWorktags in resolving duplicate worktags of a single type. * requisitionTypes: Retrieves all prompt values for requisition type. You can filter the resources by reqTypeShowAllTypes, reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, and requisitionType. More detail on how to filter using these parameters can be found in the description of each parameter. Secured by: Checkout (REST) Scope: Procurement

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A84 | Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.
A117 | Currency Conversion Rates between currency and company's default currency are not defined.
A118 | Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]
A291 | Only the purchase item unit of measure on the supplier contract line is valid.
A292 | Suppliers that are restricted to company must be restricted to either the document header company or the Company Hierarchy for which it is a subordinate.
A293 | Worktags specified are of types not valid for this transaction.
A294 | Spend Category is required on all requisition lines.
A295 | The Resource Provider provided must match the Resource Provider for the Item supplied.
A297 | Only the purchase item ordering unit of measure is a valid unit of measure.
A298 | Enter a Document Date that is between the supplier contract start date and end date.
A299 | Some worktags have invalid worktag type.
A300 | Can not have any combination of Project, Project Phase or Project Task worktags for the same line.
A301 | Certain required worktags are missing for the requisition line.
A303 | The specified Item is Invalid.
A304 | Enter a valid Unit of Measure for the purchase item. This unit of measure is not defined for the supplier.
A305 | Worktags for the requisition line are not available for use with the company for the requisition.
A306 | You must have at least 1 line with a Spend Category that has Allocate Other Charges if there are Other Charges.
A307 | [Invalid Worktags Values for Requisition]
A308 | Negative or zero amount lines can't be marked RFQ Required.
A309 | You are not authorized to request this item.
A311 | Enter an End Date on or after the Start Date.
A312 | The Ship-To Address is not valid for use on the Requisition Line.
A313 | For requisition lines tagged with a capital \~project\~ worktag, the company of the requisition must equal the company on the capital \~project\~.
A314 | One of more of worktag values are not allowed because they are inactive.
A316 | Item Description is required.
A317 | Company is required to have a value.
A318 | Enter a valid Supplier for the item's Multi-Supplier Contract.
A320 | Use a company with procurement options enabled for freight if there are Freight Charges.
A321 | Quantity must be greater than zero and cannot be partial when the document line's spend category is Tracked (unless related to a supplier contract line).
A322 | The Unit of Measure is invalid for the catalog item. Only defined units of measure for the catalog item can be used.
A324 | Enter a Requested Delivery Date that is on or after the Document Date.
A326 | Required worktag types are missing.
A327 | The total extended amount of all lines must be greater than or equal to zero.
A328 | Only the catalog item default unit of measure is a valid unit of measure.
A331 | Company is not active.
A335 | Healthcare options are not enabled for this type of requisition.
A336 | Inventory Replenishment and Par Replenishment Requisition Types are not supported.
A337 | Supplier Contract is not valid for the Company, Supplier, and Requisition Date. The contract must also allow manual requisitioning and purchasing.
A338 | Unit of Measure is required on all Item Requisition Lines.
A340 | Requisition Line is required.
A343 | Ship-To Address is required.
A344 | The currency on the requisition is not one of the acceptable currencies by [supplier]. Please select an acceptable currency or select a different supplier.
A346 | Unit Cost submitted for Item Line must match Unit Cost calculated from Unit of Measure and Purchase Item Unit Cost.
A347 | Sourcing Buyer for requisition should be an authorized buyer and should not be terminated.
A348 | Service requests are not allowed for the selected company.
A349 | The specified requester is not valid.
A353 | Create or edit of requisition line for web item is currently not supported.
A354 | Use a company with procurement options enabled for other charges if there are Other Charges.
A355 | Consignment requisitions can't be created through REST API.  Please use the application or Workday WebService operations to create consignment requisitions.
A357 | The unit cost isn't valid for the selected unit of measure.
A360 | Only the default ordering unit of measure for the supplier is a valid unit of measure. Enter a valid default Unit of Measure.
A362 | You do not have permission to order from this Supplier.
A364 | You must have at least 1 line with a Spend Category that has Allocate Freight if there are Freight Charges.
A365 | Currency is required.
A366 | Remove the RFQ Required option from the Requsition Line. You can't mark RFQ Required on requisition lines unless RFQ is configured for use.
A367 | Select either Write-In Goods or Write-In Service.
A545 | If a line is marked no-charge, then unit cost must be $0.
A546 | No charge can only be submitted on goods lines with items.
A547 | Unit Cost submitted must match Unit Cost calculated from Unit of Measure and Supplier Pricing for the Purchase Item.
A671 | Some lines on this request have an invalid deliver-to location.
A922 | Some lines on this requisition have an invalid order-from connection for its supplier.
A941 | Enable Multi-Company for requisitions or don't use a line company.
A942 | Set up an intercompany relationship between requisition company and line company using the Edit Company Intercompany Profile task.
A1069 | You’ve added an item restricted by a Requesting Entity. Select another item.
A1074 | Submit values for both External System ID and External Sourceable ID.
A1077 | Remove the line, or select a different item or inventory site. You can't add items that are restricted from purchasing or inactive for the inventory site.
A1078 | Enter a valid spend category. The requisition has lines that include inactive spend category.
A1090 | You can't submit a requisition with a requisition type that is inactive.
A1102 | The combination of external source and external ID must be unique.
A1105 | No requisition ID generator has been configured. Unable to create this requisition.
A1241 | You must have security permissions for the spend categories on each line.
A1337 | Specify a supplier. A supplier is required when the External System ID refers to Workday Strategic Sourcing.
A1338 | Set the RFQ Required field to false. RFQ Required can't be true when the External System ID refers to Workday Strategic Sourcing.
A1575 | You can only use the Purchase Items or Non-Catalog Item Requests on Supplier Contract requisition types.
A1602 | Supplier Contract Request requisitions don't support these fields on the lines: [Supplier Contract, No Charge, RFQ Required, Requested Delivery Date, Supplier Item Identifier].
A1603 | Supplier Contract Request requisitions don't support these fields on the header: [Freight Amount, Other Charges].
A1604 | The calculated extended amount on the requisition line can't be zero.
A1815 | Supplier Contract Request requisition types aren't supported for requesting entity.
A2435 | You can only use the Lot and Serial Number fields on lot and serial requisition types.
A2464 | Quantity is required and can't be negative or zero.

parameters.name: existingWorktags
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worktag. Represents worktags that already exist on a requisition or requisition line. This parameter can be passed multiple times with different values.

parameters.name: itemDescription
parameters.description: The description of an item.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: reqTypeBillOnly
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are bill only and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeBillOnly=true and reqTypeJustInTime=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeBillOnly and reqTypeJustInTime are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeBillOnly=true and reqTypeJustInTime=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeConsignment
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are consignment and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeConsignment=true and reqTypeBillOnly=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeConsignment and reqTypeBillOnly are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeConsignment=true and reqTypeBillOnly=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeInvReplenishment
parameters.description:

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeInvReplenishment=true and reqTypeJustInTime=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeInvReplenishment and reqTypeJustInTime are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeInvReplenishment=true and reqTypeJustInTime=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeJustInTime
parameters.description:

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeJustInTime=true and reqTypeConsignment=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeJustInTime and reqTypeConsignment are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeJustInTime=true and reqTypeConsignment=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeParReplenishment
parameters.description:
If true, retrieves requisition types that are par replenishment and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, , reqTypeSupplierContract.

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker for whom the requisition is requested. The reference ID uses the Employee_ID=sampleRefId format. Example: Employee_ID=21005

parameters.name: requisition
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition.

parameters.name: requisitionDate
parameters.description: The requisition date using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: requisitionLine
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition line.

parameters.name: requisitionType
parameters.description:
The Workday ID of the requisition type. If populated, retrieve all requisition types that exactly match the combination of usages of the requisition type passed (e.g. Inventory Replenishment and Bill Only). 

If not populated, the default is the combination of reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, and reqTypeConsignment.

Ignored if reqTypeShowAllTypes is populated.

post.description: Cancels the requisition with the specified ID, and terminates the Requisition business process. Specify an empty request body. **Starting in v3** Optionally specify a reason and/or comments when canceling a requisition. The reason codes are configured on the Maintain Procurement Reasons task. Secured by: Process: Requisition - Cancel, Self-Service: Requisition, Self-Service: Supplier Contact Tasks Scope: Procurement

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A332 | Current status of requisition does not allow cancellation.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of requisition templates.
get.description: Retrieves all requisition templates for creating requisitions. This operation returns only requisition templates that are authorized for use by the processing worker. The GET /requisitionTemplates returns a collection of requisition template summaries, including the name, company, the date it was created, and the total number of goods and service lines. To get the goods and service line details for a specific requisition template, call GET /requisitionTemplates/{ID} where ID is a returned id from GET /requisitionTemplates. patch.summary: Updates the header of an existing requisition.
patch.description: Partially updates the header attributes of the requisition with the specified ID. **Starting in v3:** You can call these GET /values/requisitionsGroups subresources to retrieve values for the requisition and its requisition lines. These prompt value endpoints return the values that the user has access to. * currencies: Retrieves all prompt values for currency. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate and company. * deliverToLocation: Retrieves all prompt values for deliver-to location. Only applicable to non-inventory requisitions. You can filter the resources by company, req type, and requisitionLine. * shipToAddress: Retrieves all prompt values for ship-to address. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate, company, requester, and requisitionLine. * worktags: Retrieves prompt values for worktags. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate and requisitionLine. * resolvedWorktags: Retrieves worktag prompt values that have been resolved between the existingWorktags and selectedWorktags. The returned set will have only one worktag per worktag type and be valid for submission with a requisition or requisition line. Worktags passed under selectedWorktags will take precedence between selectedWorktags and existingWorktags in resolving duplicate worktags of a single type. * requisitionType: Retrieves all prompt values for requisition type. You can filter the resources by reqTypeShowAllTypes, reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, and requisitionType. More detail on how to filter using these parameters can be found in the description of each parameter. Secured by: Checkout (REST), Process: Requisition - Create/Edit, Self-Service: Requisition Scope: Procurement

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A327 | The total extended amount of all lines must be greater than or equal to zero.
A335 | Healthcare options are not enabled for this type of requisition.
A682 | Requisition attributes cannot be edited. Remove the requisition lines to make changes to the attributes.
A1074 | Submit values for both External System ID and External Sourceable ID.
A1105 | No requisition ID generator has been configured. Unable to create this requisition.
A1575 | You can only use the Purchase Items or Non-Catalog Item Requests on Supplier Contract requisition types.
A1603 | Supplier Contract Request requisitions don't support these fields on the header: [Freight Amount, Other Charges].
A2377 | You can't edit this requisition because it either is invalid or isn't in Draft or In Progress status.
A2435 | You can only use the Lot and Serial Number fields on lot and serial requisition types.

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker for whom the requisition is requested. The reference ID uses the Employee_ID=sampleRefId format. Example: Employee_ID=21005

parameters.name: requisition
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition.

parameters.name: requisitionDate
parameters.description: The requisition date using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: requisitionLine
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition line.

parameters.name: requisitionType
parameters.description:
The Workday ID of the requisition type. If populated, retrieve all requisition types that exactly match the combination of usages of the requisition type passed (e.g. Inventory Replenishment and Bill Only). 

If not populated, the default is the combination of reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, and reqTypeConsignment.

Ignored if reqTypeShowAllTypes is populated.

parameters.description: This parameter holds a true value when Requesting Entity is selected.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of purchase orders.
get.description: Retrieves all purchase orders. You can filter the purchase orders by status, date, buyer, supplier, and other filter parameters. Secured by: Process: Purchase Order - View, Process: Supplier Invoice (OLD)+TG, Process: Supplier Invoice - View, Self-Service: Purchase Order, Self-Service: Supplier Contact Tasks, View: Organization Purchase Order Scope: Procurement, Supplier Accounts

parameters.name: buyer
parameters.description: Filters the purchase orders by buyer. Specify the Workday ID of the worker assigned as buyer on the purchase order. You can specify multiple buyer query parameters.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Filters the purchase orders by company. Specify the Workday ID of the company. You can specify multiple company query parameters.

parameters.name: excludeCanceled
parameters.description: If true, this method excludes the purchase orders with Canceled status. The default is false.

parameters.name: excludeClosed
parameters.description: If true, this method excludes the purchase orders with Closed status. The default is false.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Filters the purchase orders with document date on or after the specified date. Use the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: orderFromConnection
parameters.description: Filters the purchase orders by supplier order-from connections. Specify the Workday ID of the order-from connection. You can specify multiple order-from connection query parameters.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filters the purchase orders by status. Specify the Workday ID of the status. You can specify multiple status query parameters.

Valid values:

* 8a54a80900cb4114b62f82ed86e495f7 - Pending Issue

* dc76c312446c11de98360015c5e6daf6 - Issued 

* dc76c8bc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6 - In Progress

* dc76c4fc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6 - Draft

* dc76c7cc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6 - Denied

* 24f0f71de78540cbb1445ba9e5e94d17 - Closed

* bd5a732c160c4e84b350ba4d6f7c10c5 - Change Order In Progress

* dc76c9b6446c11de98360015c5e6daf6 - Canceled

* 91b0d382d50848e898733757caa9f84a - Approved

parameters.name: submittedBy
parameters.description: Filters the purchase orders by the worker who submitted the purchase order. Specify the Workday ID of the worker. You can specify multiple submittedBy query parameters. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing REST web service.

parameters.name: supplier
parameters.description: Filters the purchase orders by supplier. Specify the Workday ID of the supplier. You can specify multiple supplier query parameters.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Filters the purchase orders with document date on or before the specified date. Use the yyyy-mm-dd format.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves the metadata of the attachments for the specified requisition.
get.description: Retrieves the metadata of the attachments for the requisition with the specified ID. To get the file content of a single attachment, call GET /requisitions/{ID}/attachments/{subresourceID}?type=getFileContent. Secured by: REST API Public

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2377 | You can't edit this requisition because it either is invalid or isn't in Draft or In Progress status.

post.summary: Creates a new attachment for the specified requisition.
post.description: Creates an attachment for the requisition with the specified ID. The maximum file size for a single attachment is 3072000 bytes (30mb). Set the Content-type HTTP header to multipart/form-data, and specify the file location in the attachmentContent form-data field. Secured by: Checkout (REST) Scope: Procurement Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A246 | One of the following file extensions must be used: [allowed file extensions].
A252 | Enter a file name.
A280 | The file size should not exceed [file size]MB.
A319 | You cannot attach an empty file. Please select another file to upload.
A2377 | You can't edit this requisition because it either is invalid or isn't in Draft or In Progress status.

The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, , reqTypeSupplierContract. 

Example: If you specify the query parameters reqTypeParReplenishment=true and reqTypeConsignment=true, this endpoint retrieves the requisition types whose reqTypeParReplenishment and reqTypeConsignment are both true. It won't retrieve requisition types whose reqTypeParReplenishment=true and reqTypeConsignment=false.

parameters.name: reqTypeShowAllTypes
parameters.description: If true, retrieves all requisition types. If false, the requisitionType parameter will be used to filter results.

parameters.name: reqTypeSupplierContract
parameters.description: If true, retrieves requisition types that are Supplier Contract Request and whose other reqType parameters (except reqTypeShowAllTypes) are also true. The reqType parameters are: reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, reqTypeConsignment, reqTypeSupplierContract.

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker for whom the requisition is requested. The reference ID uses the Employee_ID=sampleRefId format. Example: Employee_ID=21005

parameters.name: requisition
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition.

parameters.name: requisitionDate
parameters.description: The requisition date using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: requisitionLine
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the requisition line.

parameters.name: requisitionType
parameters.description:
The Workday ID of the requisition type. If populated, retrieve all requisition types that exactly match the combination of usages of the requisition type passed (e.g. Inventory Replenishment and Bill Only). 

If not populated, the default is the combination of reqTypeBillOnly, reqTypeInvReplenishment, reqTypeJustInTime, reqTypeParReplenishment, and reqTypeConsignment.

Ignored if reqTypeShowAllTypes is populated.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of requisition lines.
get.description: Retrieves all requisition lines for the requisition with the specified ID. Secured by: Checkout (REST), Process: Requisition - Reporting, Process: Requisition - View, Self-Service: Requisition, Self-Service: Supplier Contact Tasks, View: Organization Requisition Scope: Procurement Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2377 | You can't edit this requisition because it either is invalid or isn't in Draft or In Progress status.

post.summary: Creates requisition lines for the specified requisition.
post.description: Creates requisition lines for the requisition with the specified ID. To enable bulk support for multiple requisition lines, specify "bulk=true" as a query parameter. You must specify the data[] in the request body, where each array item is a requisition line. Note that if you're adding only a single requisition line, specify the required fields without the data[]. The maximum array size is 20. For each requisition line of a catalog item, supplier item, or purchase item, specify at least item{id} and quantity. The item pricing information for the item will be derived and populated on the requisition line. **Starting in v3:** To add a write-in requisition line, specify the requisition line either as a write-in goods line or a write-in services line: * For a write-in goods line: Set writeInGoods to true. Specify itemDescription, spendCategory{id}, unitOfMeasure{id}, and quantity. * For a write-in services line: Set writeInService to true. Specify itemDescription and spendCategory{id}. Note that item lines and write-in lines are mutually exclusive. If you specify an item{id}, the pricing information on the item will take precedence over any of the information passed in manually. You can call these GET /values/requisitionsGroups subresources to retrieve values for the requisition and its requisition lines. These prompt value endpoints return the values that the user has access to. * supplierContract: Retrieves all prompt values for supplier contract. You can filter the resources by supplier and requisition. * deliverToLocation: Retrieves all prompt values for deliver-to location. Only applicable to non-inventory requisitions. You can filter the resources by company, req type, and requisitionLine. * shipToAddress: Retrieves all prompt values for ship-to address. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate, company, requester, and requisitionLine. * unitOfMeasure: Retrieves all prompt values for unit of measure. * spendCategory: Retrieves all prompt values for spend category. * resourceProvider: Retrieves all prompt values for resource provider. You can use these values for the supplier field. You can filter the resources by company, currency, supplier, and supplierContract. * worktags: Retrieves prompt values for worktags. You can filter the resources by requisitionDate and requisitionLine. * resolvedWorktags: Retrieves worktag prompt values that have been resolved between the existingWorktags and selectedWorktags. The returned set will have only one worktag per worktag type and be valid for submission with a requisition or requisition line. Worktags passed under selectedWorktags will take precedence between selectedWorktags and existingWorktags in resolving duplicate worktags of a single type. Secured by: Checkout (REST) Scope: Procurement

A325 | Unit of measure is required on item lines.

A348 | Service requests are not allowed for the selected company.
A353 | Create or edit of requisition line for web item is currently not supported.
A366 | Remove the RFQ Required option from the Requsition Line. You can't mark RFQ Required on requisition lines unless RFQ is configured for use.
A367 | Select either Write-In Goods or Write-In Service.
A1058 | Unable to add item. Someone submitted or saved your shopping cart as a requisition. Go back to your requisitions workarea and try again.
A1083 | Requisitions with a source of Workday Strategic Sourcing cannot add lines.
A1575 | You can only use the Purchase Items or Non-Catalog Item Requests on Supplier Contract requisition types.
A1602 | Supplier Contract Request requisitions don't support these fields on the lines: [Supplier Contract, No Charge, RFQ Required, Requested Delivery Date, Supplier Item Identifier].
A1604 | The calculated extended amount on the requisition line can't be zero.
